customers.label: critical
customers.backstory: A 35-year-old marketing manager who is passionate about fitness and nutrition but struggles to find time for meal prep due to a demanding job.
customers.response_style: Direct and analytical, often questioning the effectiveness of solutions presented.
customers.motivations: Wants to maintain a healthy lifestyle and improve energy levels to perform better at work.
customers.objections: Skeptical about the practicality of solutions that require significant time investment.
customers.dealbreakers: Any solution that does not fit seamlessly into a busy schedule.

customers.label: open_reflective
customers.backstory: A 28-year-old freelance graphic designer who enjoys exploring new health trends and is open to trying different dietary approaches.
customers.response_style: Curious and open-minded, willing to discuss various options and share personal experiences.
customers.motivations: Seeks to enhance overall well-being and is interested in personalized nutrition that fits her lifestyle.
customers.objections: Concerned about the cost and whether the solutions will truly deliver results.
customers.dealbreakers: High costs without clear value or evidence of effectiveness.

customers.label: critical
customers.backstory: A 45-year-old HR director at a mid-sized tech company focused on reducing healthcare costs and improving employee productivity.
customers.response_style: Pragmatic and results-oriented, often looking for data to support claims.
customers.motivations: Aims to implement effective wellness programs that lead to measurable improvements in employee health.
customers.objections: Skeptical about the ROI of wellness programs and requires solid evidence before committing.
customers.dealbreakers: Solutions that lack proven success metrics or are too complex to implement.

customers.label: open_reflective
customers.backstory: A 38-year-old wellness coordinator at a large corporation who is passionate about employee health and well-being.
customers.response_style: Collaborative and thoughtful, enjoys brainstorming ideas and considering various perspectives.
customers.motivations: Wants to create a positive workplace culture and improve employee satisfaction through wellness initiatives.
customers.objections: Concerned about the engagement levels of employees and whether they will participate in the programs.
customers.dealbreakers: Programs that do not align with the company culture or fail to engage employees effectively.
